name: unscreened
content:
unscreened adjective
(NOT CHECKED)
Add to word list
Add to word list
Unscreened people or things have not been checked or tested to discover if anything is wrong or not wanted: These workers are untrained, unscreened, and unsupervised. In these areas the disease was spreading through unscreened blood transfusions.
More examplesFewer examplesAt one airport, airlines were loading unscreened luggage onto planes.The company relied on unscreened illegal immigrants. These figures relate to the entire population, including screened and unscreened women.

unscreened adjective
(NOT SHOWN)
An unscreened film or programme has not been shown or broadcast to the public: The documentary included unscreened film from his video diaries. He directed the unscreened pilot of the show.
More examplesFewer examplesHe made the movie in 1975, but it remained unscreened until 1978.

unscreened adjective
(NOT COVERED)
not hidden, separated, or covered by a screen (= a vertical structure that is used to separate one area from another or to cover a door or window) : Prisoners shared cramped cells with an unscreened toilet. The seats in these rows will be left unscreened. In malarial areas, sleep in rooms with properly screened doors and windows - but if you are in an unscreened room, use a net impregnated with insecticide.
More examplesFewer examplesThe unscreened section of the porch overlooks the swimming pool.

Related word
screen verb
with no checks or tests being done to discover if anything is wrong or not wanted: The men were able to pass unscreened through security checkpoints in several buildings. The parasite passed unscreened through an aging water treatment plant.
